metadata.feature_description: Ensures Google Analytics connector works correctly in Azure cloud environment

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify connector installation and Azure compatibility declaration

steps.expected: Connectors page loads showing list of available connectors
steps.actual: Connectors page loaded successfully showing Google Analytics 4 connector with green checkmark indicating connected status

steps.action: Click Edit on Google Analytics 4 connector to verify UI loads
steps.expected: Connector configuration panel opens and displays settings
steps.actual: Configuration panel opened showing Measurement ID field (G-ABC123XYZ99) and Track for Administrators checkbox. UI rendered correctly without errors.

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Extensions and filter by Connectors
steps.expected: Extension list shows Evoq Content Google Analytics Connector as installed
steps.actual: Extension list displayed Evoq Content Google Analytics Connector version 10.1.1 as installed connector

observations: Code review confirmed the connector manifest (DNNXE_GoogleAnalyticsConnector.dnn) includes <azureCompatible>true</azureCompatible> flag on line 20, declaring Azure compatibility.
The connector uses TokenCachedService from Evoq.Microservices.Framework for token storage, which is designed to work with distributed cache systems compatible with Azure environments.
No Azure-specific conditional code paths were found - the connector code is environment-agnostic, relying on the framework's Azure-compatible services.

Azure-specific test scenarios (Azure deployment, Azure token storage, Azure API calls, Azure performance/scalability) cannot be executed in the localhost test environment. These would require actual Azure Web Apps deployment to verify.

The connector's Azure compatibility is primarily ensured through: (1) the azureCompatible manifest flag, (2) use of framework-provided Azure-compatible token caching services, and (3) avoidance of file-system-based session state.
